cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi south-southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north along the west coast of Florida, then turning NNE toward the Big Bend and continuing inland across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Steinhatchee River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch west of the Aucilla River to the Ochlockonee River, FL and Tropical Storm Watch north of Altamaha Sound, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River, FL; Storm Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay; Tropical Storm Warning Flamingo to south of Egmont Key and north of Steinhatchee River to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from Bonita Beach through the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely by late evening; hurricane-force gusts possible overnight into early Wednesday morning as the center passes offshore of Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 3–5 ft above ground possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 9 inches, producing flash and urban flooding and minor river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes tonight into Wednesday; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting port approaches.
